intro: Thecacoris viridis subsp. viridis, commonly known as the green spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
